meaningMnemonic:
A <kanji>gentle</kanji> and <kanji>peace</kanji>ful person is <vocabulary>gentle</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>tender</vocabulary>.

柔和 is commonly used in literature to describe someone whose nature or features express <vocabulary>gentleness</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: You didn't learn this reading of 柔 with the kanji, so let's remember it a different way. You have to be <vocabulary>gentle</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>tender</vocabulary> if you want to touch something that's <reading>new</reading> (にゅう) to this world... a puppy, a kitty, a baby, etc. Anything new needs that <vocabulary>gentleness</vocabulary>.
